title: Is it mandatory for a couple to enter Canada together if they apply for a PR as a couple? - Quora

response.answer_text: No! Being in a relationship does not require you to travel together and life rarely is that clean and well organized! Immigration Canada will not question on entry why your spouse is not traveling with you! It will be interested if your permanent address registration is different to your spouse though!
It is not mandatory, but the principal applicant has to enter first. The others can enter anytime later but within the validity of the entry visa that you received.
